title: Can anyone identify this font for me?
content:
I searched in so many places that I about to give up. Need it for a processing work. Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142713im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_4017.jpg)

 [‹ Milk's font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142713/http:/typophile.com/node/50571 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font id Please ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142713/http:/typophile.com/node/50572 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sagan

comments.content: Looks similar to the FIAT headline font. Rip-off maybe (bad kerning. free font?)
It’s not the same, and it is similarly poorly formed... but [n.o. movement](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142713/http:/www.dafont.com/n-o-movement.font) is in a similar style, and is free

Thanks Jan. It looks similar to FIAT headlines (I´ve checked at FIAT web page but there are some diferences) The M: this one has flat top, the middle vertex goes to the base and the vertex is pointed (FIAT M has pointed top and vertex and this last does not go to base) The E: the central bar is centered (in FIAT the central bar is below centre. The D, P, R, G and S are pretty equal to FIAT. Any suggestion? Thanks in advanc again.
Thank you for your help Brett but I think FIAT headline is closer than N.O. Movement.

Looks like - Public Works JNL-Regular except the O which could have been changed out by a designer to give it a different look.

Ed Maschler
I identified it: Market Deco. Thanks to everyone.
